'https://api.github.com/users/brookqin/events{/privacy}', 'received_events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/brookqin/received_events', 'type': 'User', 'user_view_type': 'public', 'site_admin': False}, 'created_at': '2025-03-01T14:34:30Z', 'updated_at': '2025-03-01T14:34:30Z', 'author_association': 'NONE', 'body': '@Stellar1999 \r\nFirst of all, thank you for responding to this issue so promptly.\r\n\r\n[rfc7231/3.1.1.1.  Media Type](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7231#section-3.1.1.1)\r\n`media-type = type "/" subtype *( OWS ";" OWS parameter )`\r\n\r\nAccording to the description in the RFC document, the `content-type` may include one or more parameters in addition to the media-type, with `charset` being just one of these parameters. There is no stipulated order for these parameters, so in extreme cases, relying on index positioning could potentially lead to issues.\r\n\r\nPerhaps it is also necessary to define a new method: `String mediaTypeParam(String name);`, to retrieve the value of a specified parameter.\r\n```\r\nString mediaTypeParam(String name) {\r\n  paramsStr = contentType.substring(X);\r\n  params = paramsStr.split(";")\r\n                    .filter(str -> str.contain("="))\r\n                    .map(str -> str.split("="));\r\n  return params[name];\r\n}\r\n\r\nvar charset = mediaTypeParam("charset");\r\nvar boundary = mediaTypeParam("boundary");\r\n```', 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/dubbo/issues/comments/2692261461/reactions', 'total_count': 'public', 'site_admin': False}, 'created_at': '2025-03-01T14:53:30Z', 'updated_at': '2025-03-01T14:53:30Z', 'author_association': 'CONTRIBUTOR', 'body': '> @Stellar1999 First of all, thank you for responding to this issue so promptly.\r\n> \r\n> [rfc7231/3.1.1.1. Media Type](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7231#section-3.1.1.1) `media-type = type "/" subtype *( OWS ";" OWS parameter )`\r\n> \r\n> According to the description in the RFC document, the `content-type` may include one or more parameters in addition to the media-type, with `charset` being just one of these parameters. There is no stipulated order for these parameters, so in extreme cases, relying on index positioning could potentially lead to issues.\r\n> \r\n> Perhaps it is also necessary to define a new method: `String mediaTypeParam(String name);`, to retrieve the value of a specified parameter.\r\n> \r\n> ```\r\n> String mediaTypeParam(String name) {\r\n>   paramsStr = contentType.substring(X);\r\n>   params = paramsStr.split(";")\r\n>                     .filter(str -> str.contain("="))\r\n>                     .map(str -> str.split("="));\r\n>   return params[name];\r\n> }\r\n> \r\n> var charset = mediaTypeParam("charset");\r\n> var boundary = mediaTypeParam("boundary");\r\n> ```\r\n\r\nThanks for your review.\r\nI think my new code does not rely on an index for positioning. (If you mean indexOf, it\'s only used to get the charset string.) Like you said, maybe we can find a better general method to retrieve more parameters. However, as I see in the Dubbo code, it only relies on the charset. So, I believe we just need a special method to obtain the charset.', 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/dubbo/issues/comments/2692268656/reactions', 'total_count': 0, '+1': 0, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 0, 'confused': 0, 'heart': 0, 'rocket': 0, 'eyes': 0}, 'performed_via_github_app': None}]

'public', 'site_admin': False}, 'created_at': '2025-02-13T04:26:27Z', 'updated_at': '2025-02-13T04:27:27Z', 'author_association': 'CONTRIBUTOR', 'body': 'Hi,@zhenglin523\n\nThis issue is not related to the Dubbo community. The root cause is the recursive call caused by the @ToString annotation in the Squad and Member classes, which results in a StackOverflowError. Squad contains a collection of Member objects, and Member contains SquadRole and MemberStatus enums, all of which use Lombok\'s @ToString annotation, leading to the recursion.\n\nTo fix this, you can:\n* Exclude the members field in the Squad class using @ToString(exclude = "members").\n* Manually implement the toString() method to avoid recursion.\nThis issue is not related to Dubbo but is caused by mutual references between objects and the recursive nature of the toString() method.', 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/dubbo/issues/comments/2655447275/reactions', 'total_count': 1, '+1': 1, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 0, 'confused': 0, 'heart': 0, 'rocket': 0, 'eyes': 0}, 'performed_via_github_app': None}]

'site_admin': False}, 'created_at': '2025-02-08T12:37:53Z', 'updated_at': '2025-02-08T12:42:32Z', 'author_association': 'CONTRIBUTOR', 'body': "1. NacosRegistry#subscribeEventListener will create RegistryChildListenerImpl:\n```\nprivate void subscribeEventListener(String serviceName, final URL url, final NacosAggregateListener listener)\n            throws NacosException {\n        Map<NacosAggregateListener, Map<String, EventListener>> listeners =\n                nacosListeners.computeIfAbsent(url, k -> new ConcurrentHashMap<>());\n\n        Map<String, EventListener> eventListeners = listeners.computeIfAbsent(listener, k -> new ConcurrentHashMap<>());\n\n        // create RegistryChildListenerImpl\n        EventListener eventListener = eventListeners.computeIfAbsent(\n                serviceName, k -> new RegistryChildListenerImpl(serviceName, url, listener));\n\n        namingService.subscribe(serviceName, getUrl().getGroup(Constants.DEFAULT_GROUP), eventListener);\n    }\n```\n2. RegistryChildListenerImpl will create a RegistryNotifier as it's notifier, if nacos notify the latest data once Sub, the notifier of RegistryChildListenerImpl will execute doNotify method when the notification is received:\n```\n        public RegistryChildListenerImpl(String serviceName, URL consumerUrl, NacosAggregateListener listener) {\n            this.serviceName = serviceName;\n            this.consumerUrl = consumerUrl;\n            this.listener = listener;\n            this.notifier = new RegistryNotifier(getUrl(), NacosRegistry.this.getDelay()) {\n                @Override\n                protected void doNotify(Object rawAddresses) {\n                    // call notifySubscriber here if nacos notify the latest data once Sub  <<<=============== SEE HERE !!!\n                    List<Instance> instances = (List<Instance>) rawAddresses;\n                    NacosRegistry.this.notifySubscriber(consumerUrl, serviceName, listener, instances);\n                }\n            };\n        }\n```\n3. Calling namingService.getAllInstances and notifySubscriber in NacosRegistry#doSubscribe will be redundant and might cause concurrent issue, i think such codes should be removed if nacos notify the latest data once Sub.\n```\n                for (String serviceName : serviceNames) {\n                    List<Instance> instances =\n                            namingService.getAllInstances(serviceName, getUrl().getGroup(Constants.DEFAULT_GROUP));\n                    notifySubscriber(url, serviceName, listener, instances);\n                }\n```", Please show me the configuration thanks.\n\n```\n@Bean\n@Primary\n@ConditionalOnMissingBean\nObservationRegistry observationRegistry(List<MeterObservationHandler<?>> handlers, ObservationPredicate predicate)\n{\n    ObservationRegistry registry = ObservationRegistry.create();\n\n    registry.observationConfig()\n        .observationHandler(\n            new ObservationHandler.FirstMatchingCompositeObservationHandler(\n                new SkywalkingMeterHandler(new SkywalkingMeterRegistry())))\n        .observationHandler(\n            new ObservationHandler.FirstMatchingCompositeObservationHandler(handlers))\n        .observationHandler(\n            new ObservationHandler.FirstMatchingCompositeObservationHandler(\n                new SkywalkingSenderTracingHandler(),\n                new SkywalkingReceiverTracingHandler(),\n                new SkywalkingDefaultTracingHandler()))\n        .observationPredicate(predicate);\n    \n    return registry;\n}\n```\n```\n@AutoConfiguration\n@ConditionalOnClass({TraceContext.class, SoaDubboConfig.class})\npublic class SoaSkyWalkingDubboConfig\n{\n    @Bean\n    ApplicationModel applicationModel(ObservationRegistry observationRegistry)\n    {\n        ApplicationModel applicationModel = ApplicationModel.defaultModel();\n        applicationModel.getBeanFactory().registerBean(observationRegistry);\n        \n        return applicationModel;\n    }\n}\n```", 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/dubbo/issues/comments/2727507875/reactions', 'total_count': 0, '+1': 0, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 0, 'confused': 0, 'heart': 0, 'rocket': 0, 'eyes': 0}, 'performed_via_github_app': None}]

Dual registration mode will be used, resulting in both the http port and dubbo port on a microservice being registered with nacos. Therefore, when the spring gateway obtains nacos services, after Load Balancer, it will poll and invoke these two ports, and it will be found that each time succeeds and the other fails.\r\n\r\n\r\n![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/da4cef3f-438e-4dc9-9d9a-b741a3594be7)\r\n', 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/dubbo/issues/comments/2583045075/reactions', 'total_count': 0, '+1': 0, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 0, 'confused': 0, 'heart': 0, 'rocket': 0, 'eyes': 0}, 'performed_via_github_app': None}]

\n> my code:\xa0\xa0ÊàëÁöÑ‰ª£Á†ÅÔºö\n> \n>       <dependency>\n>         <groupId>org.apache.dubbo</groupId>\n>         <artifactId>dubbo-spring-boot-autoconfigure-compatible</artifactId>\n>           <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>\n                <artifactId>spring-boot-starter</artifactId>\n            </exclusion>\n        </exclusions>\n    </dependency>\n response.\n\nIn certain scenarios, we want to encapsulate some common logic in a unified manner. For example, we would like to directly map some rules based on `spring.profiles.active` to fixed `dubbo.registry.group`, and unify the `dubbo-registry-local.cache` path, etc.\n\nThis approach aims to streamline configuration management and ensure consistency across different environments or profiles. Currently, I haven\'t encountered any issues using version 3.3.0 in IDEA.@11D-Beyonder\r\n\r\nI did not find the cause of the problem, but there are some clues to offer.\r\n\r\nI came to the conclusion that the values of `package` and `option java_package` in the IDL file must be the same.\r\n\r\nFor example, if the IDL file is like this:\r\n\r\n```protobuf\r\npackage org.apache.dubbo.springboot.demo.idl;\r\noption java_package = "org.apache.dubbo.springboot.demo.idl";\r\n```\r\n\r\nor the `java_package` is not specified, the request to `http://localhost:50052/org.apache.dubbo.springboot.demo.idl.Greeter/greet/` works fine.\r\n\r\nHowever, if the `java_package` is specified and don\'t equal to the value of `package`, the request will fail. For example, if the IDL file is like this:\r\n\r\n```protobuf\r\npackage org.apache.dubbo.springboot.demo.idl;\r\noption java_package = "org.apache.dubbo.springboot.demo.api";\r\n```\r\n\r\nThe request to both `http://localhost:50052/org.apache.dubbo.springboot.demo.idl.Greeter/greet/` and `http://localhost:50052/org.apache.dubbo.springboot.demo.api.Greeter/greet/` will fail.\r\n\r\nI\'m a beginner to Dubbo, and I don\'t know if this is a Bug or a design consideration. Hope to get some answers, thank you. @heliang666s ', 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/dubbo/issues/comments/2416519905/reactions', 'total_count': 0, '+1': 0, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 0, 'confused': 0, 'heart': 0, 'rocket': 0, 'eyes': 0}, 'performed_via_github_app': None}, {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/dubbo/issues/comments/2416597235', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/apache/dubbo/issues/14781#issuecomment-2416597235', 'issue_url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/dubbo/issues/14781', 'id': 2416597235, 'node_id': 'IC_kwDOAEfiCM6QCljz', 'user': {'login': 'heliang666s', 'id': 147408835, 'node_id': 'U_kgDOCMlHww', 'avatar_url': 'https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/147408835?v=4', 'gravatar_id': '', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/users/heliang666s', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/heliang666s', 'followers_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/heliang666s/followers', 'following_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/heliang666s/following{/other_user}', 'gists_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/heliang666s/gists{/gist_id}', 'starred_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/heliang666s/starred{/owner}{/repo}', 'subscriptions_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/heliang666s/subscriptions', 'organizations_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/heliang666s/orgs', 'repos_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/heliang666s/repos', 'events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/heliang666s/events{/privacy}', 'received_events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/heliang666s/received_events', 'type': 'User', 'user_view_type': 'public', 'site_admin': False}, 'created_at': '2024-10-16T11:54:22Z', 'updated_at': '2024-10-16T11:55:20Z', 'author_association': 'CONTRIBUTOR', 'body': 'This is not a bug; it is intentionally designed this way. Since proto files are used, the `protoc` compiler from the Dubbo plugin will be invoked during the compilation phase to generate Java files. For the specific implementation, refer to `org.apache.dubbo.gen.AbstractGenerator`.\r\n\r\nIn simple terms, you need to ensure that **the import paths in both the provider and consumer match the `java_package` exactly**. The reason you encountered errors after modifying the` java_package` is that the original import paths were not updated accordingly. As a result, the import statements could not find the corresponding files, causing the startup to fail.\r\n@11D-Beyonder', 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/dubbo/issues/comments/2416597235/reactions', 'total_count': 0, '+1': 0, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 0, 'confused': 0, 'heart': 0, 'rocket': 0, 'eyes': 0}, 'performed_via_github_app': None}]

The expectation is that the future is not set, and I saw that paragraph.\r\n\r\nThe default value expected by the code is false, which means that future is not set to prevent memory leaks.\r\n',
